definition:
Let $A$ be an $n \times n$ matrix over $\mathbb{R}$. A *group inverse*
for $A$ is an $n \times n$ matrix $X$ such that $$\begin{aligned}
AXA &= A \\
XAX &= X \\
AX &= XA.\end{aligned}$$ Such a matrix, when it exists, is unique and is
denoted by $A^{\#}$. A group inverse is a special case of a Drazin
inverse.
